intro: Baryxylum grande, commonly known as the large baryxylum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 centimeters in diameter. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a hairy texture. Baryxylum grande is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
